alert.note: Alert for Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 01 at 4:57AM AKST until February 02 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Skagway and the Klondike Highway. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM Tuesday to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snow is expected across Upper Lynn Canal beginning Tuesday evening and continuing through late Wednesday night. Heaviest snowfall rates expected late Tuesday night through Wednesday morning. Lighter snowfall rates likely Wednesday afternoon and evening. Additional light snow is expected to continue through the end of the week; however confidence is low regarding a possible transition to rain at sea level.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
